channel.title: Middlesex University
channel.description: A world where everyone holds the power to employ science and creativity for good.

item.title: A MASSIVE THANK YOU from the SMASHfestUK Team
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: A massive THANK YOU to everyone who took part in Smashfestuk this week, and to everyone who came and visited us! We hope you all had a fun time, learnt lots about ‪#‎science‬ ‪#‎stem‬, stretched your creativity and curiousity and found out how to survive a ‪#‎Solarstorm‬. A massive THANK Read more…
item.content:encoded:
A massive THANK YOU to everyone who took part in Smashfestuk this week, and to everyone who came and visited us! We hope you all had a fun time, learnt lots about ‪#‎science‬ ‪#‎stem‬, stretched your creativity and curiousity and found out how to survive a ‪#‎Solarstorm‬.

A massive THANK YOU to our partners and sponsors! We couldn’t do it without your belief and support. Thank you to:

Middlesex University 

The Wellcome Trust

The Arts Council

The Royal Society of Chemistry

Science and Technology Facilities Council

University of Greenwich

Greenwich and Lewisham Young People’s Theatre

Royal Observatory Greenwich

Vound Software

L&Q Housing

Lewisham Borough Council

SMASHfestUK is a ‘not-for-profit‘ festival, and we are very grateful to all our partners for their support, but in order to make the festival bigger and better (and remain free!) we are grateful for any help you can offer. You can make a donation here: ./../../../support/index.html Or learn how to get involved here: ./../../../get-involved/index.html
The hope is to expand the festival, so who knows, SMASHfestUK may pop up in your local area as well as Deptford! Keep an eye out on our website and our Facebook/Twitter pages for future news, and thank you once again for your support!
The SMASHfestUK Team

item.title: Lewisham Youth Conference 2015
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: Goldsmiths University Saturday 21st February TICKETS: Free but you must register in advance All of the stories and events at SMASHfestUK are inspired by, and designed to uncover how studying subjects in science, technology, engineering and maths can be useful in a myriad of jobs and careers. From architecture, to construction, Read more…
item.content:encoded:
Goldsmiths University

Saturday 21st February

TICKETS: Free but you must register in advance

All of the stories and events at SMASHfestUK are inspired by, and designed to uncover how studying subjects in science, technology, engineering and maths can be useful in a myriad of jobs and careers. From architecture, to construction, from plumbing to sanitation and humanitarian work, from music and film to health and beauty, zoology and lots more, a basic grounding in STEM can open doors to all kind of futures. It also gives you a solid grounding in critical thinking which is useful no matter what you decide to do with your life. The idea that a studying science can only lead to a job in a laboratory wearing a white coat is now history! Come and find out more!

LYC 2015 aims to provide young people with an empowering and inspiring environment offering a wealth of knowledge in the form of information stands, educational workshops and entertainment! Elevating Success – working in partnership with Lewisham Homes – the main sponsor, is committed to improving the life chances of young people in its communities. This event will inspire and empower the young people attending, with the ultimate aim of attendees leaving with the knowledge and motivation needed to achieve their dreams. If you would like to book your free ticket to the event, simply fill in the sign up form here. We’ll see you there!

item.title: Dr Suze Kundu launches SMASHfestUK’s series of talks with Nanoscience 101
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: “My journey to being a nanoscientist”, by Dr Suze Kundu, launched the SMASHfestUK series of talks. It is part of the SMASHfestUK 2015 Talk Series, hosted at the Middlesex University, London. (This is the first of 4 films)
item.content:encoded: “My journey to being a nanoscientist”, by Dr Suze Kundu, launched the SMASHfestUK series of talks. It is part of the SMASHfestUK 2015 Talk Series, hosted at the Middlesex University, London. (This is the first of  4 films)

item.title: What IS SMASHfestUK?
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: SMASHfestUK, is a science, technology, engineering, maths and medicine through the arts and design festival for young people, in Deptford, South East London during the February half term holidays. A mix of entertainment, sic-fi and immersive adventure  the festival is themed around a gripping story of a unifying threat Read more…
item.content:encoded:
SMASHfestUK, is a science, technology, engineering, maths and medicine through the arts and design festival for young people, in Deptford, South East London during the February half term holidays.

A mix of entertainment, sic-fi and immersive adventure  the festival is themed around a gripping story of a unifying threat to humanity!

The pilot in 2015 had an asteroid on a collision course with Planet Earth and an ensuing zombie invasion. Visitors will had the chance to plan for Armageddon, whether it was preparing for survival, singing for their lives at the End of the World Cabaret, creating a time capsule or taking a trip to the Intergalactic Travel Agency.

2016 has us facing a Super Solar Storm, which will destroy all of our electrical and electronic infrastructure and will plunge us back into the mechanical age, while human mutations run rampant due to the effects of huge UV radiation.

SMASHfestUK is the first event of its kind, designed to widen participation and build diversity in science, technology, engineering and maths (STEM) by engaging young people and hard to reach audiences.

SMASHfestUK is the creation of science TV production company The Refinery, with Middlesex University as the lead partner. It is supported, in 2016, by The Wellcome Trust, The Arts Council, The Royal Society of Chemistry, the Science and Technology Facilities Council, Lewisham Borough Council and the University of Greenwich.

In 2015, the pilot year, it was partnered with the Stephen Lawrence Charitable Trust, the Wellcome Trust, Middlesex University, and the Royal Observatory Greenwich.

SMASHfestUK Press Release 2015

SMASHfestUK Press Release 2016

item.title: SMASHfestUK Talks Series Kicks Off with Nanotech
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: Dr Suze Kundu, launches the SMASHfestUK series of talks this evening with “How nanotech can save us post-asteroid-impact!” at Middlesex University. For Science!!!!
item.content:encoded:
Dr Suze Kundu, launches the SMASHfestUK series of talks this evening with “How nanotech can save us post-asteroid-impact!” at Middlesex University.

For Science!!!!

item.title: Crowdsourcing An Apocalypse
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: SMASHfestUK has been created to engage young people in STEM subjects through participatory stories, and activities. These activities will eventually manifest as parts of a strong crowdsourced narrative. Some of our potential participants have already started working on their involvement in the festival. Here are students at the Middlesex University Read more…
item.content:encoded:
SMASHfestUK has been created to engage young people in STEM subjects through participatory stories, and activities. These activities will eventually manifest as parts of a strong crowdsourced narrative.

Some of our potential participants have already started working on their involvement in the festival. Here are students at the Middlesex University gearing up for the final showdown…

Showdown at Preparations Middlesex Uni
